In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""

    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width
            error("Word larger than text width")
        end

        # Add space before new word, and newline when necessary
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
        else
            wrapped_text *= " "
        end

        wrapped_text *= word
    end

    return wrapped_text
end
```

And here's an example of using the `wrap_string` function:

```julia
text = "In computer science, artificial intelligence (AI) is the simulation of human intelligence processes by machines, especially computer systems."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This will print a wrapped version of the text, with each line respecting the `text_width` parameter.
